Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2016 04:15PM - edited Apr 20, 2016 04:16PM by suki1724 I just had my meeting with the genetic counselor and due to not only breast but GI cancers on both sides, I was able to have the 32 panel test, which is the most comprehensive, and covers other mutations besides just BC. I'm happy that I did it but as soon as the blood was drawn, of course the anxiety started. They told me about 4 weeks for results, hoping it's sooner. I'm scheduled for a breast MRI on May 4th and I may push it out three weeks, just so I can deal with one thing at a time, but I'm going to check with the breast surgeon and make sure she's ok with it. Did anyone here have the 32 panel test? How long did it take for results?

Posts.Content: suki1724 wrote: Hello, I've been having abnormal mammo and multiple scans done on my right breast and have a complex cyst, and they said I could either watch and wait or have a biopsy. I have a strong family history, so I definitely want the biopsy. My wonderful doctor said he will get me in next week with an excellent breast surgeon, but I was thinking that radiologists do these biopsies too? I had two thyroid nodule biopsies in the past, one with a surgeon that was really rough, I looked like I got punched in the neck. The second one was with a radiologist and it was 100 times easier and less painful than the first. I'm hoping this isn't a similar situation for breast biopsies? I will be needing a core biopsy. Any feedback will be great. I know that most of these complex cysts are benign, but I've just gone though watching my mom with BC and it's hard. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2015 07:22PM suki1724 wrote: Hi Again Everyone, I saw the breast surgeon today and I really liked her. She did an ultrasound herself and felt comfortable waiting 6 months for another diagnostic mammo, ultrasound and possibly MRI or biopsy on the right breast. She told me I need to get off HRT and I'm really upset because I have gotten so sick every time I've tried to lower or go off of it. She said the key is to do it gradually, so I have to call my gyne and get her thoughts. I'll be 50 in April, my mom didn't go through her change until about 55, so at least I'm somewhat close to that. I had a complete hysterectomy at age 40 and I've been on low-dose HRT since that time.
